textDetails.title: Perfect for both business and leisure
textDetails.positiveText: The location in the city is perfect for both business and leisure (it's near the beautiful Leadenhall Market). There's a tube station right across the street. The gym is well-equipped and offers a very nice view. The staff is incredibly friendly and goes above and beyond to ensure a perfect stay, including accommodating early check-in and late check-out requests. I will definitely stay there again.

textDetails.title: Amazing stay
textDetails.negativeText: There was literally nothing to complain about here. It’s a gorgeous place, outstanding facilities and the food is just out of this world lovely.
textDetails.positiveText: The hotel is gorgeous but what sets this place apart are the people. You can have gorgeous locations which are thoroughly ruined by rude, unapproachable staff. The staff here are lovely, polite, professional but above all warm.

textDetails.title: Comfortable
textDetails.negativeText: Very surprised to be told on checkout that there was a 5% discretionary charge added to the bill. This is highly unusual and not customer-friendly, surely the room rate offered should be covering all costs and fees. It made the overall experience less enjoyable and I would think twice before booking this hotel again especially in a city like London where there is huge choice at a similar price point
textDetails.positiveText: Modern, clean and friendly hotel

textDetails.title: we had the best time , honestly a fantastic hotel . Thank you Jasper for looking after us so well.
textDetails.positiveText: Breakfast was incredible , rooms was amazing . Staff were very friendly.

textDetails.negativeText: They charge us for sort of candles we never even seen, so needed to call them and ask what was the charge for. But in few days it was sorted, thanks
textDetails.positiveText: Everything
textDetails.title: Great! Love Pan Pacific

textDetails.positiveText: Spotless.

Kelly Vo

textDetails.title: Luxurious
textDetails.positiveText: An amazing luxury hotel which was made extra special by the hotel staff. The relaxation area was superb and the room was very clean and spacious. The bar area was really nice for a drink before heading out in London. The finer details within the room made us feel really special.
textDetails.negativeText: Slightly frustrating that children were playing in the pool outside of the allotted pool times. However, once the pool cleared out it was an amazing space. We were also surprised by the added discretionary service charge of 5% as we thought this would be included in the room rate.

partnerReply.reply:
Dear Tom,

Thank you for your wonderful review. I'm delighted to hear that our staff and facilities enhanced your stay. It's great to know you enjoyed the relaxation area, spacious room, and our bar.

I apologize for any inconvenience caused by children in the pool outside the designated times. We appreciate your feedback and will ensure better enforcement of pool rules. Regarding the service charge, we will make efforts to communicate this more clearly in the future.

We look forward to welcoming you back soon.

Best regards,

Kelly Vo
Guest Services Manager

textDetails.negativeText:
The service left a little to be desired. We had to ring down because an hour after check in our luggage still hadn’t arrived in our room. A staff member then appeared at our room and asked what our luggage looked like - not good! On check-in the staff member didn’t show us where to go or how to get to our room. It all felt very impersonal. When we were checking out, they seemed surprised we had left our luggage in the room to be collected. This is fairly standard in luxury hotels. We did joke that they’d lose it after the farce at check-in. 
This could so easily be one of the best hotels in London but the service needs to be improved.

The service (having someone drop by in the evening, open the bed, close the curtains and line up the slippers at the foot of the bed is much appreciated). And the "wow!" effect when entering the room for the first time and having the curtains opening automatically to reveal the fantastic view! Same for the lights that automatically turn on when entering the room. Great! The bathroom was exceptional - the door separating the toilet from the rest of the bathroom is much appreciated and rare.
textDetails.title: An exceptional hotel with top-notch service

textDetails.positiveText:
The location for business in the City of London is almost unbeatable - excellent location across the road from Liverpool St. 

The rooms are also large by London standards and extremely well appointed, you don’t feel cramped.
textDetails.negativeText:
I’ve given the property an 8/10.

Firstly, it’s an excellent hotel but I do think the £450-£500 per night is pretty high. 

Secondly, the billing process is quite frustrating. Amounts are ‘held’ on your account (but in my experience actually charged) for incidentals but then you are billed again when you check out meaning you’re left waiting for substantial refunds (in my instance are £800). My bill was also wrong when I checked out but I identified that before leaving. It shouldn’t be so complicated.
textDetails.title: Excellent, well located City hotel.

partnerReply.reply:

Should you need further assistance, please do not hesitate to reach out to me directly. On behalf of the team at Pan Pacific London, I really hope that we will have the opportunity to welcome you back soon.

textDetails.negativeText: The main detraction for this hotel is the uncomfortable sagging bed matrass and too soft of pillows, both of  which continues to be my chief complaints of this hotel, as I have stayed at this hotel previously. See pic of bed. You can actually see the center sagged noticeably. I would think a hotel rated as 5 Star and charging fairly high premium guest prices could do a better job with getting better quality bed matrasses for their guests.
textDetails.positiveText: The main selling point for this hotel is its proximity to the Liverpool City Train Station and nearby markets.
textDetails.title: The hotel is brand new and ultra modern with a pleasant and professional staff.

partnerReply.reply:
Dear Robert, 

Thank you for choosing the Pan Pacific London and for taking the time to leave us a review. We are pleased to hear that our staff were professional and helpful and that you appreciated the location near Liverpool City Train Station and nearby markets.

We understand that comfort is paramount during your stay, so we apologize if our bed matrasses and pillows did not meet your standards. Please know that your feedback has been taken into account and rest assured, we will continue working diligently to ensure all guests have a comfortable experience while staying with us. 

We sincerely appreciate you taking the time to share your experience with us and look forward to having you back in the near future.

Sincerely yours,
Xinchen Li

textDetails.title: Almost perfect
textDetails.positiveText: We had a wonderful stay. The room, shower and facilities (like the pool) were perfect. The staff was very friendly and helpful.
textDetails.negativeText: Only one thing we really didn’t like: When we received the bill at the end of our stay, we noticed a higher amount per night than the amount on our Booking information. When I mentioned this, they said they included a 5% service charge. I told them I wanted to pay the amount as agreed upon, so they changed the amount per night back to what it was. We know that more hotels and restaurants in London add a service charge. This was however the first time it wasn’t even stated on the bill as an extra, they just added it to the amount per night, so the only way to notice, is if you know exactly what you’re supposed to pay. We felt a bit deceived…

partnerReply.reply:
Dear Loek,

Thank you for taking the time to share your experience at the Pan Pacific London. We are delighted that you enjoyed our room, facilities, and friendly team during your stay. 

We sincerely apologize if there was any confusion regarding the cost of your stay. Here at Pan Pacific London, we strive to be transparent with all charges and fees associated with a guest's stay. We regret if that was not communicated accurately in this case and would like to thank you for bringing it to our attention. 

We appreciate your feedback and hope that you will give us another opportunity to provide a better experience in the future. 

Sincerely yours,
Xinchen Li
Guest Relations Manager

textDetails.positiveText:
Overall this hotel exceeded my expectations. The location is great, super modern, clean and confortable, quiet and unpretentious.
Let me address upfront the few negatives of this stay:
	- The pool water was not perfectly clean and there was also some dirt on the surrounded floor. I don't mind the children classes in the restricted schedule since the reception staff kindly informed us soo. Nevertheless the pool didn't felt cleaned for a hotel of this class. It should be a open shower directly near the pool and the staff should inform people to take a shower before entering the pool (no one did).
	- The recpetion lobby feels somewhat small and mainly executive style.. they could have done so much more here.. maybe more suitable for the residences entrance than the proper hotel.
	- Didn't like the reception desk so close to the near guest... it felt wrong. They should be more separated instead of the huge fake plants crowding the reception desks... the complimentary small cake was not good also. Overall not a good check in and first impression.
	- The extra charge prices at breakfast. For the price tag at least toast and different eggs styles should be included.
The remaining aspects of this stay were very good indeed. I really appreciated:
	- The huge bathroom. Modern, beautiful and functional. Clean aesthethic and amazing Diptyque bath products! Very nice indeed. I wish there was a bathtub though. In the first day a slight sewer smell appeared after using the shower but didn't felt any other time.
	- The size, design and confort of the room. Nice appointed mechanical curtains, very unique design, great furniture materials and perfect condition. Didn't like the carpet as some fibers come out easily. Bed really good indeed. Overall a very pleasant room.
	- Room cleaning was very good.
	- The hotel location was a big plus.
	- The hotel was quiet and relaxed at all times.

So would I return there? Definitely!
textDetails.title: True modern uppscale stay with amazing value!

partnerReply.reply:
Dear Nuno,
It was wonderful to have you staying with us.
Thank you so much for taking the time to write about us and share your valuable feedback.
I am pleased to see that you have enjoyed your stay overall, to be able to look after you, we were truly humbled. 
Service is at the heart of everything we do, therefore your experience is truly important to us! I really appreciate your honest feedback as this allows us to look into the areas that have fallen short and make improvement to ensure similar issue do not happen to your future stay and other guests. 
As for Reception, we have taken your feedbacks fully on board, we will take these into consideration when reviewing the hotel renovation in the future. At the same time, I would like to confirm that all plants and flowers in our hotel are fresh, they are looked after by a professional gardening company. I would take your comment of "fake plants" as a compliment as this means the potted plants must have looked in great condition so that they almost looked unreal. 
Regarding the complimentary cake, please accept my most sincere apology. From our tracked record, I could not locate that we have sent a cake to your room, therefore I would be the most grateful to know which cake we have sent so that I may investigate further. 

Dear Nuno, once again, I would like to thank you for choosing to stay at Pan Pacific London. On behalf of the team at Pan Pacific London, we sincerely hope that we will have the opportunity to welcome you back soon. 

Kindest regards, 
Xinchen Li 
Guest Relations Manager

textDetails.title: Pleasant and elegant modern hotel with gracious staff.
textDetails.negativeText: Breakfast was not included in an already pricey room. The movies were to be rented, leaving the poorer selections in the TV channels.  There was no socket for the hairdryer inside the bathroom, which is a common phenomenon in UK and European bathrooms. Looked like a flick of human matter/or other organic matter on the wall by the mirror in the bedroom.  Room service did not answer for a while, perhaps 30 mins, and we called about 8 times. Those leather chairs in the Orchid lounge look nice, but are not comfortable.  Are insect decors really an Asian thing?
textDetails.positiveText: Food was good that we ordered in room service. Generally very quiet, with exceptions of noise, screams outside the room and outside the building, but that cannot be helped so much.  The help were courteous. Liked that the room was cool enough at night, the small amenities, e.g. toothbrush and paste, comb,  etc.

partnerReply.reply:
Dear USA,

Thank you so much for taking the time to write about us and sharing your feedback.

Service is the heart at everything we do and I am delighted to know you enjoyed your stay in general. At the same time, I am disappointed to learn that the stay was marred by several inconveniences. Please accept my most sincere apologies for this.

As a property, we do provide the movie service with an additional charge due to licensing. However, we also have the "Chromecast" option, where the guest can connect their personal device and stream Netflix, Spotify, YouTube, etc. on the TV.  In regards to the socket, as we need to comply with UK law, it is permitted to install electric sockets in the bathroom, except for electric shaver. We have done our best to install multiple sockets in the living/ bedroom area, especially next to the mirror for our guests' convenience. Our Housekeeping manager also went to inspect the room and looked into the spot that you mentioned. We can confirm that this is a mark of paint which we have now manage to remove. 

In addition, I am sorry to learn about your experience with our Room Service. This has been brought to the attention of our managers, who will make sure the same issue does not happen again. Overall, we really appreciated your comments as it will help us tremendously to improve and provide such wonderful service as we promised.

On behalf of the entire team, I sincerely hope to have the opportunity to welcome you back to Pan Pacific London! Should you plan to return, please do let me know as I would love to look after you personally.

Warmest regards,

Kelly Vo
Guest Services Manager

textDetails.positiveText:
Flawless room, excellent view, spectacular pool and the perfect location for all of London. Shangri-la at the Shard used to be a favourite hotel of this standard in London, it's not a patch on Pan Pacific. As a new hotel it still has a freshly finished feel about it. 

Staff were friendly, efficient and welcoming. Shout out to Alex who show us to our room and also the in-room dining folks and reception team who are aged delivery of a pre-ordered lunch to our room precisely on-time just minutes after our arrival. 

Dinner at Straits kitchen was superb. The deserts were another level of awesome. Service was outstanding and cocktails particularly good.

The spa area and pool is a major selling point. With rain (pretty common in London) over the weekend we stayed, it was the perfect place to go instead of braving the weather. 

Location could not be better. Views of many famous skyscrapers from your window.
textDetails.title: Stay here, forget everywhere else, it won't be as good.
textDetails.negativeText:
To be ultra picky, breakfast could be better. Milk for cereal needs to be kept in a cool container (nobody wants room temp milk on their cornflakes). Service was a little fussy... I can live with a wrapper from the cube of sugar I just put in my coffee sitting on the table for a few minutes.  

That's it though. Told you it was ultra picky.

partnerReply.reply:
Dear Kevin,

Thank you so much for taking the time to write about us and share your feedback.

I am delighted to know you enjoyed your stay in particular the room, the view and the pool. I am also pleased to see that Alex had looked after you so well, I will ensure to share your feedback with him who will be encouraged from your kind words. 

I truly appreciate your feedback in regards to breakfast service, this allows me to look into it to to improve our service in the future.

I look forward to welcoming you back in the near future.

Warmest regards,

Xinchen Li
Guest Relations Manager

textDetails.title: My No.1 choice for London
textDetails.positiveText: Breakfast buffet spread was decent and small but slightly overpriced. Staff were all friendly, helpful & professional. The hotel kept to very high cleanliness standard, smells like heaven (think frangipani), housekeeping team doing a great job (to the extent of even arranging all my skincare & makeup products according to size & type), in-room service great, other facilities like gym, pool, and drawing room are really cozy & well-runned. Everything in the room were well-designed & really makes sense from a user perspective. It’s a room that I felt like nothing was wasted, every furniture and feature serves a purpose. It is only after we checked into another chain 4 star hotel at Regent’s Park later that we realised how much we took Pan Pac for granted. We already miss the pleasant smell, the coziness of the room, the flawless facilities, a bathroom that JUST works, excellent pantry supplies, the Diptyque toiletries, the location, the bed & pillow that transport you to another deep sleep world and not having to pull all curtains yourself by hand. Pan Pac is the golden standard for modern day hotels that every other hotel chain should strive to match.
textDetails.negativeText:
The most annoying part of my stay was that the housekeeper always leave out the dirty short glass without cleaning them (but they cleaned everything else). No idea why specifically just the short glasses always get left out. 

Also housekeeper kept moving the dyson hair dryer back into the bathroom where there was no plug point. So we had to keep moving the hairdryer & the stand back into the room itself for access to a plug point. Despite informing the housekeeping team twice, the hairdryer still got moved back into the bathroom. I started to think this must be a prank for not tipping enough especially the day we left a  handwritten note that says “please do not move the hair dryer back into the bathroom”, when we came back we found the housekeeper moved ONLY the hairdryer stand back into the bathroom. I mean, what is the obsession with moving hairdryer back into the bathroom?!!

Also I didnt find the afternoon tea savoury treats up to standards - they were cold & tough. The tea, cakes & scones were good though.

partnerReply.reply:
Dear Nandeska,

It was wonderful to have you staying at Pan Pacific London. 

Thank you so much for taking the time to review your stay and share such wonderful and detailed feedbacks. 

Whilst I am so pleased that you have had a pleasant experience overall, I would like to address the areas that have marred your stay with us. I have spoken to our Housekeeping Manager personally, please accept my sincere apology about leaving the dirty short glasses behind. Our Housekeeping team will perform training regularly and ensure similar issue do not repeat itself moving forward. 

Concerning the Dyson hairdryer, it was placed in the bathroom on the first day as per our and Forbes standard. After the team was informed with your preference, it was instructed to be placed with the stand in the bedroom on the shelf until your departure. I have also updated on your profile to ensure it is placed at your preferred location for all your future stays. 

I am disappointed that our afternoon tea savoury treats were not delivered to the high standard that we aspire to. textDetails.positiveText:
The little touches were excellent, from the complimentary bottles of water at check in (well needed after walking round London all day!) to the lovely chap called Len who accompanied us to our room and offered to carry our bags. We enjoyed the room, the facilities are top notch. Excellent bathroom with fantastic Diptique toiletries and a Dyson hairdryer alongside solid water pressure. There are some really classy touches too such as a small teapot. 

It was our anniversary and the team at the hotel sent us a complimentary brownie to our room around 30 mins after we arrived which was a real lovely touch.

The Spa is a great addition to the stay also, made for a nice leisurely morning before check out, set us up well for our final day in the city.
textDetails.title: Everything I'd hoped for

textDetails.positiveText: I love the pool, and the kids love the pool. Many hotels limit children's pool times to narrow unhelpful slots and get upset when they jump in or splash (Park Plaza Westminster Bridge - talking about you). NOT HERE! They give the girls floaties and were delighted the girls were enjoying themselves. That was after the treasure hunt and the free teddy. The reception when we arrived was warm and welcoming (always is, I stay here for work regularly), and the staff are lovely.
textDetails.negativeText:
This is a pet hate of mine. I hate my kids being offered a kids' menu of burgers and chips and other junk food. I preferred them to have smaller portions of real food available. Instead, here I must order adult portions at adult prices. No, obviously they can't share a single dish because they will never order the same thing - only a non-parent would even ask this question...
It will not stop me from coming back again and again. I will just eat out.
textDetails.title: Love the room, love the pool, love the staff, will be back...My children's favourite London hotel

textDetails.negativeText:
However, the level of service needs tending to. We arrived at 10pm after a long day travelling, we had a very warm welcome but check-in took ages and they accidentally tried to charge us multiple times which was very embarrassing for us as the payment took the first time but then looked like we didn’t have enough money. They also pre charge a £100 deposit per night, which is very excessive and unnecessary. The Porter then brought us up to the room and although he was very nice, he was really unable to read that we were tired and just wanted to head straight to bed - he overstayed his welcome to be honest.
The spa is lovely, but the heated pool is freezing and the sauna and steam rooms are cold.
Another odd experience was a woman letting herself into our room without knocking. She seemed shocked we were there and quickly left the room. I wasn’t decent and the encounter seemed very unofficial as the room had already been turned down. We were left feeling spooked out to be honest, what reason would she have to just walk in to the room without ringing the bell.
Lastly, the food in the Straight’s Kitchen was so bad that we didn’t eat it and left.
textDetails.positiveText: Great location and the actual hotel and rooms themselves we’re definitely luxurious - from the amenities in the room (Diptique products, luxurious robes, Dyson hairdryer) to the style and technology.

textDetails.positiveText:
Rooms super nice, great view, special requests accomodated too, lovely 5* staff across the hotel who were always very attentive, chatty and making your stay better...
Nice gym & fully equipped to do like 95% of excercises, only thing on the videos on the website there is a video of a punch bag with gloves, but it's not there...(not a huge deal for 99.9% of the clientele I imagine but still a valid point.)
Amazing swimming pool with nice view of Liverpool Street, good to relax.
Location is great, 2 min walk to Liverpool Street.
Staff in Lily bar were really amazing and really took care of the cocktails they made. They make you want to come back every night to enjoy the vibe. Specifically, one night I had a cacao based old fashioned and it was A**** , highly reccomended, I wish I had the recipe to make back home! So please staff if you read this review, can you obtain the recipe for me :)) The service from the Ukrainian lady, the other ladies and Italian guy there was super too!! 5*
Didn't have breakfast there, at 35GBP per breakfast, not worth it imo. Should revise pricing of Breakfast based on local proximity of other restaurants serving breakfast at a cheaper rate.
Will be back when back in LDN - but not for the breakfast :)
Thanks again Pan Pacific.

textDetails.title: Overall dispite the negatives, it was a great stay.
textDetails.negativeText:
We ordered room service & was told that it would be 30 minutes max, after 1 hour I called to check and was told it would be a few minutes.. we waited another 15 minutes and called back to find out that they had no record of our order at all. weird. 
The pool was actually too cold, it was supposed to be 30 degrees but way too cold to relax in. 
Something minor is that the windows were very dirty, couldn’t take photos. 
Someone else’s hair on the floor / towel. 
As we only had one night here it was ruined slightly & inflicted our plans for the night.
textDetails.positiveText: Upon arrival we were greeted by the friendly staff and made welcome, we got shown to our room & everything explain thoroughly. The hotel itself is amazing, beautifully designed & modern. The location is great with plenty to do around the area.

partnerReply.reply:
Dear ASHLEY,
Thank you so much for taking to time to review your stay and share your valuable feedback.
Service is at the heart of everything we do therefore your experience truly matters to us. 
Whilst I am so pleased that you have enjoyed your stay overall and felt well looked after, I am disappointed that we didn't afford the level of service we aim to achieve in several areas. 
I have shared your comments with the In Room Dining Manager who will ensure the similar issue do not repeat itself again in the future. 
Our swimming pool temperature is set at 30 degree by the pool management company. This is the most suitable temperature to ensure the chlorine is kept at the safest level for children. It was a shame that our Wellbeing team didn't guide you through this. As if you swim a few minute, it will get much warm and you will not feel cold again. 
I am sorry that the windows were dirty during your stay. Our windows are clean regularly however, sadly in London they can get dirty quicker due to the air pollution and the birds. I sincerely hope on your next stay, the view from the room will be much clearer and beautiful for photos. 
Should you have a plan to return to the city of London, I would like to ensure you are looked after by myself and the Guest Relations Team. We will ensure your next stay is a perfect experience!
On behalf of the entire team, I wish you a Happy New Year!
Sincerely yours,
Xinchen Li
Guest Relations Manager

textDetails.negativeText: Only downside is that i seem to have been charged more for the daily room rate than was specified by booking.com when i booked (payment was made at the property after we had stayed and not prior).

partnerReply.reply:
Dear Claire,
Please accept our heartfelt thank you for staying at Pan Pacific London.
Thank you so much for taking the time to review your stay and share your honest feedback.
Service is at the heart of everything we do and your experience truly matters to us.
I am pleased that our butler Vijay has looked after you so well. Rest assured, I will pass on your feedback to Vijay who will be grateful with your kind words. 
Please accept my most sincere apology about the room charges. The extra charges for your room was the added breakfast, which have been charged twice. We must apologise to you profusely. I can see this has been refunded to you. We will be extra careful when post charges to avoid the same mistake happen again. 
Claire, I sincerely hope we will have an opportunity to welcome you back in the near future. 
Sincerely yours,
Xinchen Li
Guest Relations Manager

textDetails.title: 3rd Stay in my fave Hotel in London
textDetails.negativeText: Had to queue up for the lifts on check in due to bad timing I think as there was a Honda party of people in the meeting hall area....Took like 15 mins to get from check in desk to going up lift..Glad it was clear when I went back down lifts in me dressing gowns for the spa
textDetails.positiveText: There really isnt much I can add to my 2 previous reviews, This Hotel is quite simply the best in London for me, Upon check in this time I was given an unexpected room upgrade free of charge from the wallbrook Suite to the Bishopsgate suite, Wow the room was perfect, The views, The bed, The space 11/10...I actually had a Spa massage this time around and that was very enjoyable, Took evening dinner once again in the Straits Kitchen and the food is immense, Also tried out the Silver leaf as its new since I last stayed, Very casual and slightly difficult to understand the cocktail menu however the bar tenders were very helpful.....Took an early morning swin and sauna with no one else there appart from me and my partner so was a delight

textDetails.negativeText: My reason for giving a 9 instead of a 10 is the room service / pool service food - this is where the hotel was let down. We ordered room service a couple of times and found the food to be sub par and often incorrect. For instance, I ordered a 3 egg omelette for breakfast and was sent an omelette made of egg whites only which did not taste nearly as good as it would have if the yolks had been included. We ordered fries on another occasion, and the bowls / portions were absolutely tiny, especially for the high price. We also ordered food to the pool, and I ordered a set menu item of scrambled eggs on toast with smoked salmon. The meal arrived with no salmon included, and the eggs had not been seasoned at all and tasted very bland. Compared to other five star hotels, the room service / poolside meals were not up to standard, but otherwise this hotel was wonderful!
textDetails.title: Wonderful luxurious stay!
textDetails.positiveText: A wonderful, luxurious, very new hotel, with great facilities and friendly staff. We were very happy to be upgraded to a room with a view on arrival, and the woman at the check in desk showed us to our room and showed us around which was a nice touch. The view from the 16th floor was incredible, and the room was beautiful, spacious and had everything we needed - the mini bar offerings were especially great. The Diptyque toiletries were a real treat also! We loved the pool, though we felt it was a little cold in temperature, and the 'no kids' hours were not strictly in place - we headed down at one point during the 'no kids' hours to find multiple kids splashing and shouting and disturbing the ambiance. I loved the drawing room where I was able to do some work in peace, though as I was the only one in there I was surprised no staff came to offer me a menu or ask me if I needed anything - I would have ordered some coffee and maybe a snack whilst I worked. The staff at the door of the hotel who would greet us every morning were especially friendly and kind. Ginger Lily bar was wonderful, we got some tasty cocktails and finger food there.

partnerReply.reply:
Dear cleoambre,

Thank you so much for taking the time to review your stay at Pan Pacific London and share your valuable feedback. 

I am pleased that you have enjoyed your stay in so many ways and felt well looked after by our team. I will ensure to share your wonderful feedback with our team who will be encouraged by your kind words.

I would like to extend my most sincere apology about your In-Room-Dining experience. I have spoken to our In-Room-Dining Manager Agnes personally and reviewed all issues happened during your stay. We have investigate the areas that have fallen short, and looking into ways to improve the quality control process to ensure similar issues do not repeat themselves in the future. 

Once again, thank you so much for choosing to stay at Pan Pacific London. I sincerely hope we will have an opportunity to welcome you back in the near future. 

Warmest regards,
Xinchen Li
Guest Relations Manager

textDetails.negativeText:
Room for improvement - £35 for a cooked breakfast per person and then an added service charge. I've had better service in Costa. Cutlery removed from the table, when we had just finished so would have had to ask for extra cutlery if we had wanted to go back for more. We asked for a fried egg from the lady who cooks them, to be told that she would bring it over, it never arrived, not surprising when she appeared to be on her phone, no toast. 
Trivial but - The chairs really drag across the floor and they are very noisy and close together and no plate warmer to heat plates.
I would say the service and experience at breakfast is what has let our experience down. I had expected to pay this amount for breakfast but it's an insult when you get slapped with a service charge for no real service.
I didn't see any instructions on how to use the digital lockers in the pool changing area - a note inside the locker would have been useful along with a changing room (I didn't see one) - I know that my mum wouldn't have been comfortable to change infornt of other people.
textDetails.positiveText:
Shown to our room by the very pleasant and helpful Alex. Our room was on the 11th floor, it was very clean, spacious, modern, with a great view and beautiful bathroom. The fire doors were surprising quiet, we didn't here any other guests doors slamming or banging through the night. 
The bed seemed quite soft to me, not ideal for me but my husband found it very comfortable (personal preference).
The infinity pool was beautiful

textDetails.positiveText:
To start, the staff where amazing. Months have passed since my stay at the hotel and I'm still struck by the level of customer service! I arrived at the hotel hot and bothered after trying to navigate the underground. Concierge noticed my dishevelled state and offered me a drink, putting me at ease. The attentive nature of the staff and their warm hearted nature sets this hotel apart from other hotels in the city. 

Next, the styling of the hotel is so unique, from the unique interior design, to the colour schemes, the stunning uniforms for the staff m, immaculate rooms and the breath taking bathroom's! The hotel takes styling to a new level and adds its own personal signature to every visual element present at the hotel. 

Finally the hotels location is perfect! It's within the vicinity of many landmarks, as a tourist this was perfect! Moreover, there are many fantastic restaurants, unique stores and cultural spaces near by. 

I recommend this hotel to all of my friends and I will definitely visit again in the future!

textDetails.negativeText: We had two rooms. One was ready (after 3pm) - the other wasn't. We waited for 45 minutes past the check in time for the second room. Inconvenient as we had plans and wanted to unpack. The room service - hidden in tiny print (that I missed) along with allergy info. £5 delivery charge AND a 12.5% service charge. I don't object to the charges but please tell people when they are ordering. The tea bags provided are suited to those who like weak tea. I went out and bought my own good quality tea from a nearby supermarket.
textDetails.positiveText: The people on staff are the stars here. Friendly, helpful and efficient - always happy to help. Lovely spacious modern room. Kettle (bliss) and coffee maker with good quality pods. Diptyque toiletries. The sound insulation was excellent - almost no outside noise (amazing for a city).  Beautiful swimming pool - I was lucky and had it to myself two out of three visits. It only takes a family and two couples to feel overcrowded. I think there should be separate times for people with young children. Fast smooth lifts and plenty of them. Heated towel rails - lovely for damp swimsuits. We loved the location as it suited our plans but note that it's not central London.
textDetails.title: Lovely Modern Hotel with Beautiful Pool

textDetails.title: Impeccable service, absolutely stunning hotel, definitely stay here!!
textDetails.positiveText: It was exceptional - the service was absolutely 5 Star - we felt like we were the only guests in the hotel! We picked this place for our wedding night and honestly, it was one of the nicest hotels we've ever been to! The room was stunning, they upgraded us (what a treat!) and the views were insane. They had Diptique toiletries so gives you an idea of the level to expect from the place. We loved enjoying the pool and sauna/steam in the morning and enjoyed making use of the cocktail bar and Straits bar too. The hotel has pretty much everything you need and I wish we could have stayed for longer! The butler remembered our names when we were leaving - just little touches where nothing was too small or too much for the team. The service was impeccable! All of the staff were so welcoming and accommodating and made our wedding night even more special! LOVE and will definitely be back if/when we can!!

partnerReply.reply:
Dear Jessica,

What an honour to have you staying with us to celebrate such a special occasion!

Thank you very much for taking the time to share your wonderful feedback.

I am so delighted to know that you have enjoyed your stay. I am also thrilled to see that we have exceeded you expectation and made you feel so well looked after. I will ensure to share your wonderful words with our team and with Vijay, our Butler in particular who would be encouraged by your kind feedback.

On behalf of the entire team, I sincerely hope to have the opportunity to welcome you back to Pan Pacific London to celebrate your next special occasion. 

Sincerely yours,

Xinchen Li

textDetails.positiveText:
The customer service was excellent at every area of the hotel, what being an A list celebrity must be like. It really separates this from other hotels. Happy I came here for my birthday.
Particulary worth mentioning are Rena, and the tall model-like girl at breakfast front desk. Smilet at dinner front desk who took great care of my elderly mother who has limited mobility and ilias, the lead waitor at dinner.
Room: spacious, quiet, with great city views. The bed was huge, comfortable  and there were excellent amenities.
Breakfast: excellent hot and cold selection at buffet, and a chef onsite for custom egg dishes.  Very good quality fresh and tasty food also the best pandan kaya I've had in the UK outside of my visits to Malaysia and Singapore.
Dinner: compliments to the dessert chefs from my family
In room dining (IRD): fantastic, managed to get a tasty  fresh meal at 4am and it arrived quickly too.
Facilities: Spa, Sauna, infinity pool and had a really good pain-relieving massage treatment and rest in the relaxation room. Front desk manager was very accommodating of my changing birthday schedule.
Hotel Building: new, modern, luxurious but modest.
The Pan Pacific I've stayed in at Singapore was very flashy and huge. This one is a great compliment to it.
Lastly:  very happy a friend recommended it, I'd say the same to anyone planning to stay here.  I look forward to coming back and was advised there will be manicure and pedicure treatments available by then too.
textDetails.title: A truly 5 star experience that exceeded 40th birthday expectations.
textDetails.negativeText:
What was not to standard was immediately addressed with hotel management of who, Tom and Callum were excellent:
No TV channels were working on the first night I arrived so I was compensated with a free breakfast. Staff also came with me to my room to try and setup Chromecast for me instead. 
Hotel room not refreshed and IRD table not removed after 1st night. I then received a rather odd, prickly and incorrect phone response from a female staff member when I called about it. Resolved with management who sent staff within a few minutes who's professionalism outweighed the above.

The staff ! Every single one of them were so nice to us and our toddler. 
They helped us in every way, gave us a free upgrade and provided us with the best baby bed! 
Super quiet room, very very comfortable bed and calming decorations .
The spa was also super nice ! 
Restaurant /breakfast options very nice !
textDetails.negativeText:
The bath tub is not comfortable as it s very hard in the neck and also very deep. 
The water temperature of the swimming pool is too cold and also the overall temperature in the spa area around the pool is too cold. 
My son was shivering and we packed us with several towels. 
Also the connection of the reception/room service was very bad and took us up to more then 10’ waiting times (3 times we had this). We had to go down to the reception to ask for what we needed … you do not expect this at a 5 star hotel
textDetails.title: Absolute kids friendly place

partnerReply.reply:
Dear Elke,

Thank you for your constructive and considerate feedback and I am glad that overall you had an enjoyable stay. I am glad that you took advantage of the hotel facilities, and the team looked after your little VIP so well.

Concerning our Wellbeing Floor, the pool is heated at what we anticipate to be a comfortable balance for those swimming and those relaxing at 30 degrees but as the surrounding area is heated at a higher temperature, you may notice the difference when you enter the pool. We will of course bear in mind your feedback for future considerations. Please accept my apologies that there was a delay in connecting your call to one of our Service One Agents, this should not have happened and we are continually looking into ways to manage our call log during busy periods. 

I hope we will have the chance to welcome you back soon and please do not hesitate to contact us in advance of your next stay so we have the chance to personally oversee your visit.

Sincerely Yours,

textDetails.negativeText: Nothing
textDetails.title: Incredible luxury and exceptional staff
textDetails.positiveText:
We stayed at the Pan Pacific on the last day of our honeymoon before heading to Heathrow in the morning. The staff was exceptional from the very beginning of our stay - assisting us with luggage, ensuring we had anything we needed, and booking us a car for the next morning. The room had amazing views and amenities including some excellent tea. The Straits Kitchen was a fantastic meal to end our time in the UK and the hotel room was a great place to simply relax. We didn't have enough time to make full use of the pool and sauna, though we saw both and they looked great. 

The cherry on top is we were greeted in the morning downstairs by name (despite staff changeover) and they helped us into the car which was there waiting for us as promised. Since we had an early flight, not having to worry about anything was spectacular.

partnerReply.reply:
Dear Trevor,

Thank you for your glowing review and it is a true pleasure to read that you had the chance to fully envelop yourself within the hotel and enjoy so many of our facilities and amenities. Service is at the forefront of everything that we do and so it is wonderful to know that you were so well looked after by the team.

I look forward to welcoming you back soon.

Sincerely Yours,

Callum Newton
Assistant Front of House Manager

textDetails.positiveText: The hotel was amazing 😍 the staff were brilliant, they honestly couldn't do enough for you. The hotel is in a great location, 2 minutes from Liverpool Street station, the bus stop was directly outside for various different locations as desired. The bars in the hotel were beautiful, the food and drinks were lovely. The indoor swimming pool is beautiful and heated, with great views. The beds around the pool are as comfy, which are great to relax and have a drink if swimming isn't for you - the pool towels are available on on all beds and extras if required. It was an absolute pleasure to stay here. Thank you Pan Pacific.
textDetails.negativeText: My only issue and I regret not saying something to the hotel reception was that the shower in the room was pretty poor. The power was very low which resulted in showering taking longer than it should require. But that's a very small negative in what was a very pleasurable stay we had.

textDetails.negativeText: The only downside was the noise from the City. I booked a city deluxe view room. At night, we could hear large sirens and rowdy party goers which did disturb me in my sleep. I would advise booking a room facing away from the station, and will request this when I stay again
textDetails.title: Unmatched luxury hotel - impeccable service and luxury accommodation at an affordable price
textDetails.positiveText: Almost everything. The hotel had a sophisticated and calming atmosphere. The service was outstanding - all staff were extremely attentive. The room was pure luxury, with a super king size bed, large walk in shower and impressive in room amenities (including Dyson hairdryer, wide selection of tea and coffee and Diptyque bathroom products). The pool was also a great location to relax with views of the city. The photos do not do this hotel justice. For the price of a night stay, compared with other hotels in London, Pam Pacific London is unmatched and I would highly recommend.

partnerReply.reply:

I am very sorry that noise in the city disturbed your sleep. We will note this in your profile to assign a suitable room for your future stays.

We sincerely hope that we will have an opportunity to welcome you back to Pan Pacific London in the near future! Once you have a reservation in place, please do reach out to me as I would be delighted to oversee your stay personally.

textDetails.positiveText: everything was more than perfect. love everything, every small details of this amazing hotel. it's newly opened. just in September. away from Central London but that's what I was looking for. but still with the underground you will be there within minutes. the hotel has a great friendly team.  I am gonna call them that because they do work as a team to make sure that the guest is more than  comfortable at their hotel. WOLTER he is the first Guy I noticed when I left the car even before entering the hotel. he has a good sense of humor, very welcoming and friendly he was with us until we entered our room and told us great information about the hotel and explained everything  to us. then my experience begin when I entered the hotel. everyone was welcoming us and ask if we had a good trip to the hotel. and trying to help. TOM at reception, he is very friendly. tried his best to make sure that we are happy and comfortable with our room. and he recommended us with a room that has a great view. and I am a glad that I took that room. it has a great view which I enjoyed day and night. ( thank you TOM for being a part of our lovely experience at pan pacific .  And also CHRISTOPHER at the reception. honestly the reception team are just ( great ). also TOM at the Concierge, he helped me with everything and arranged for my PCR test so I wasn't worry about anything and just enjoying my time over there. ( in general the Concierge team are really great and trying their best to make you happy). CYRIL ( the man with the smile  that you can feel even behind the face mask) was always there. asking if we need anything. and if we are enjoying our time. HE is always checking when we passed by him.  every  name that I mentioned above they always ask and check.THANK YOU  pan pacific team for every moment that I enjoyed. definitely will come again next year.

textDetails.positiveText:
I loved the staff! I came here for my birthday and was greeted with 5* service, which I know this hotel is now known for, with a chocolate tart and apple tea and shown up to my room with everything explained which really made me feel at home. Staff were so polite and really wanted to make your stay the best it could be. Me and my friends came in late at night and were greeted with slippers in exchange for our heels and bottles of water - 5* service to the next level!

The interior is just as gorgeous in real life than on pictures, we had a city view room and it was perfect - the bathroom was a pleasure to be in, filled with diptyque and had heated floors following to a super luxe walk in shower. (They even had boxes of iphone chargers and a ‘romantic’ box for couples looking to spice things up in their stay!)

The spa was lovely too and a lovely touch free of charge inclusive of the stay. My massage was amazing and the therapist really took her time to know what I wanted out of my massage with creating my own oil blend bespoke for me.
textDetails.negativeText: The room service food & mini bar was so expensive, eg 4 for a small pot of pringles and £16 for avocado on toast.
textDetails.title: Luxury with 5* service ~ it lives up to it’s hype!

textDetails.title: Excellent hotel providing genuine 5 star service.
textDetails.negativeText:
Found the pool was a little cold
Slightly disappointment with the Traditional Afternoon Tea experience, as struggled to enjoy the intense mix of flavours and ingredients.  However, the service was impeccable with an amazing attention to detail.
textDetails.positiveText: Everyone was friendly and welcoming, although a special mention goes to Walter for his chats and top tips.  The luxurious rooms are spacious, with equally large marble bathrooms and from the moment of entering, create a quiet, relaxing oasis.  From the complimentary toiletries, to the quality appliances provided, there was nothing not to like! The large infinity pool is attached to the Wellbeing area and a great area to enjoy a pamper session.  Can definitely recommend the holistic massage!  Cocktails in Ginger Lily were delicious, perfectly chilled, and full of flavour.  Located close to Liverpool Street station, there’s a fantastic choice of bars, restaurants within a short stroll or otherwise, can hop on a bus or tube for a short ride into the West End

textDetails.title: Excellent - the best hotel I've stayed at in London!

textDetails.positiveText:
Loved the Pan Pacific decor and vibe , staff made you feel very welcome and comfortable ,stayed in room 1417 which was so lovely 
On entering the hotel greeted by Taeyong , it was my daughters birthday and Vijay concierge showed her around the cocktail bar and where they serve high tea whilst I checked in they made such a fuss of her she love doing it.
Vangelis, part of the concierge team, escorted my daughter and I to our room and showed all the settings for the room , it was amazing. May daughter and I went out shopping and when we returned  to our room there was a card and a lovely bottle of red wine.
We then decided to eat at the restaurant and Vijay booked that for us. We had a beautiful meal served by Manuel and was surprised with a cake for my daughter.
I can truly say that this stay in Pan Pacific was amazing and the staff we met were so friendly and professional and catered to our needs.
Thank you Flavia,  Taegong, Andre,Xinchen, Manuel and the biggest thanks goes to Vijay and the so lovely Vangelis
I hope the staff mentioned get to see this review

textDetails.title: a VERY special place.  Calm among the buzz.  Can't wait to return!
textDetails.positiveText:
WOW.
This hotel is a very special place.
The staff are all absolutely outstanding.
We stayed for our wedding anniversary and they really went the extra mile to ensure it was the most wonderful celebration.  The staff are at the heart of the hotel.
Nothing is too much trouble and the team are so welcoming and friendly.
The hotel is full of understated luxury and is a soft, relaxing space amid the buzz of London.
The room was beautiful and calming, the bathroom was elegant and immaculate.
Room service was excellent, we had lunch in our room and the service was fast and the food was delicious.
The pool is open until 10:00pm and that made such a difference to our visit-we went exploring in the day and used the pool facilities in the evening.  I do wish the pool was slightly warmer, a few other guests said the same.
Changing rooms each have a sauna and steam room in them which were lovely.
Robes were exceptionally soft and warm-not made of the usual flannel. 
Singapore influence gives attention to detail throughout the hotel-curved lines, few harsh edges, the foliage, room layout, materials & colours used gives it soul that many others lack.
If you want to stay in a luxurious yet peaceful and thoughtful place, I highly recommend the Pan Pacific Hotel.
We absolutely can't wait to go back next year, and the year after that, and the year after that...

textDetails.title: Very pleasant stay and great customer service, go to if you are staying in the Liverpool Street area
textDetails.negativeText: I would not recommend the breakfast or midnight meal (after 10pm).
textDetails.positiveText:
We had an excellent stay at Pan Pacific London.

Really well positioned, opposite Liverpool Street Station. We had a nice city view and the customer service is what really made this experience. Perhaps this is because they have only been opened for 2 months, I really hope they continue at this level.

Everything felt modern and state of the art, with Dyson hairdryers, modern gym facilities and decent pool length (with a nice view). We have previously stayed with them in the flagship Singapore branch but the overall stay felt like a 4 star hotel (some feel like 5 star) and facilities were dated.

As for food, I tried to order the Hainanese chicken rice for dinner but due to a quality issue the head chef refused to serve it. Instead I opted for the lamb, it was the nicest lamb I have ever tasted (and I often order room service) with a good portion, tasty flavours and fluffy couscous. The in-room dining manager Cosmin gave a complimentary desert to make up for the lost time and I had the dark chocolate mousse (apparently exclusively curated by Cherish Finden) which, was a nice finish to my meal.

Consequentially, I ordered a pizza and fries for a midnight snack. For breakfast we had a full English breakfast and the Asian breakfast (Gaya toast and wonton noodle soup) but all were lacking and not worth the price tag. I wonder if this is due to the time when the head chef was not around (dinner time).

Finally, we finished off the stay with the afternoon tea and this was a pleasant experience. The dim sum was a bit so so, interesting take and catchy to the eye but you will find better flavours in most China Town dim sum restaurants. The experience and dishes progressively got better, finishing with the signature plate of sweets and the flavours were incredible, with a really refined palate. The lychee desert for me was the winner.

Even though we only stayed for a weekend due to a meeting in the city, I would definitely recommend it if you need to stay in the area.

We have done a lot of London weekend stay-cations this year and Pan Pacific has now become our new favourite hotel in London. Every staff we have encountered, from the concierge to the Straits Kitchen team, made us felt welcomed and comfortable, hats off to the managers and to everyone works here, the vibe is energetic and genuine,

Not to mention how beautiful the place is and the attention of detail paid to the design, from the selection of crockery & cutlery, hair and body products to all the beautiful plants surround, we appreciate the overall sustainable approach; and of course, the room is so quiet despite in such a busy location and the bed is superb for good night sleep!

We left the hotel feeling happy and refresh, and will definitely come back, even just for a nice meal or afternoon tea.

textDetails.negativeText: There weren’t any niggles really, but as Booking.com are asking for it, I should add the following: 1) At breakfast it would be really nice to have your own pot of coffee on the table, or at least having it served a little more quickly (this is my darling wife) … 2) I think being able to get a ‘proper’ English breakfast tea at appropriate strength in one’s teapot at breakfast might be nice, i.e. two to three teabags of the ‘Pan Pacific House English Breakfast Tea’ per pot might be a good idea, and not just the one. I know, I could have asked for it but didn’t, so as just to see what they might do. The blend of the breakfast tea however was very good indeed … 3) It would also be nice to have the breakfast-included bits of the menu - in my case poached egg on toast - be displayed a little less ‘coldly & basic’, e.g. maybe a little decoration like dried parsley sprinkled over the plate, etc.
textDetails.title: Utterly remarkable all the way
textDetails.positiveText: A wonderful 5-star experience so very, very close to Liverpool Street Station. - From the moment I approached the doormen I was taken care of in the nicest possible, elegant and inobsequious way I remember of any 5-star anywhere. From Alex (?) the concierge, to Kelly the receptionist who was kind enough to show me to my room personally and give me a charming induction to the tech involved. Although this was mostly work, my wife and I managed to get a lovely later-evening out of it. I think the best recommendation one may afford a place is to return, and we’re returning very soon for a non-work related, full three-night weekend in the City and beyond.

textDetails.title: Amazing place 10/10!
textDetails.negativeText: It was an incredible hotel but I would say the only thing that wasn’t 10/10 was the room service meal, especially for the price. We went for the Parma ham pizza after getting in late from our show and it was not very good. Also it would be great to have some biscuits or similar with the tea and coffee in the room :-).
textDetails.positiveText: The wellbeing centre was amazing- gorgeous pool and spa facilities. The doormen were very polite and friendly as were all of the staff- everyone who passed you greeted you with a warm and friendly manner and wanted to help. The duck spring rolls from the Ginger Lily bar were one of the best pieces of food I’ve EVER had. The rooms are of an exceptional standard, great amenities and state of the art bathrooms and beds. Thank you so much!

partnerReply.reply:

Thank you so much for taking the time to review your stay at Pan Pacific London.

I am very pleased to hear that you had a memorable stay with us and being so well taken care of by our colleagues. At the same time, I am sorry to hear that the in-room dining meal you had was not up to standard. I truly that this did not take the shine too much off what was otherwise an enjoyable stay and rest assured that your feedback will be passed on to our Management team to review.

We sincerely hope to have an opportunity to welcome you back to Pan Pacific London in the near future!

Warmest regards,

Kelly Vo
Guest Services Manager

pillows were so hard so very uncomfortable night sleep.

textDetails.title: Luxury stay at Pan Pacific hotel London
textDetails.positiveText: This hotel is exceptional from the service to the room amenities. We felt welcome as soon as we entered the building, nothing was too much trouble. Very attentive service given by the lovely staff at pan pacific. The room was beautiful, it keeps the oriental theme throughout. It does not feel like you’re in London but somewhere exotic. The room was huge and had everything you needed for a relaxing break. We stayed in a deluxe room with x2 double beds, they were huge and super comfy! the bathroom was so beautiful. The shower could fit in about 10 people. It was especially touching receiving a call at the door with a hand written note and luxury chocolates to wish myself a happy birthday. We loved the free use of the well-being floor. The pool is huge and the views are amazing, you feel so relaxed looking out at passes by as you relax in the calm surroundings. Will definitely be coming back very soon!

partnerReply.reply:
Thank you so much for your wonderful review of Pan Pacific London, and I am delighted you enjoyed your time with us. We aim to bring a slice of Singapore to the city of London so it is humbling to know you felt that, and furthermore that you took advantage of our Double Double rooms. 

We look forward to welcoming you back again soon.

Sincerely Yours,

Callum Newton
Assistant Front of House Manager
